Text.Name: CollectionAndProcessing
Text.Desc: Learn basic material acquisition and processing in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Tasks.2.TaskDesc: Tap the target tree and issue a Chop order.
Text.Tasks.3.TaskDesc: Tap the cancel button to leave the chop selection state.
Text.Tasks.4.TaskDesc: Click the Cancel button to deselect the chopping target
Text.Tasks.6.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.7.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.11.TaskDesc: Tap Chop and begin chopping down the tree.
Text.Tasks.12.UiData.Name: Chop
Text.Tasks.17.TaskDesc: Tap Confirm to issue the order
Text.Tasks.18.TaskDesc: Drag and select a target area to issue Chop in batch.
Text.Tasks.23.TipsData.Desc: The tutorial uses lumber collection as an example, and other materials such as ores, metal, food, etc. are collected in a similar way, which the player will experience in the game.
Text.Tasks.25.TaskDesc: Tap Workstation to begin the placing mode.
Text.Tasks.26.TaskDesc: Place the workstation at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.27.UiData.Name: Work
Text.Tasks.29.TaskDesc: Place the workstation at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.33.TaskDesc: Select a workstation to show its status below.
Text.Tasks.37.TaskDesc: Tap Close to close the Produce page.
Text.Tasks.37.UiData.Name: Produce
Text.Tasks.38.TaskDesc: Wait until the production is complete.
Text.Tasks.40.TaskDesc: Click Close to close the Produce page.
Text.Tasks.41.TaskDesc: Wait until the production is complete.
Text.Tasks.43.TipsData.Desc: Material processing is normally done in corresponding buildings, and Workstation in this tutorial is only the basic material processing station. As the game progresses, the player will unlock more specific material processing stations such as Wood Processing Station, Stone Processing Station, Furnace, etc. for more efficient material processing.

Text.Name: BuildRoom
Text.Desc: Learn basic room construction in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Chapters.0.Tasks.1: Set an Entrance for the Room
Text.Chapters.0.Tasks.4: Wait until the construction is complete.
Text.Tasks.2.TaskDesc: Select the Material tab and check all the materials
Text.Tasks.2.UiData.Name: Material
Text.Tasks.3.TipsData.Desc: We have enough resources, now let's use them to build a room for characters to live in.
Text.Tasks.5.TaskDesc: Tap Build in the bottom left corner to open the Build page.
Text.Tasks.6.TaskDesc: Tap Wall to begin the placing mode.
Text.Tasks.7.TaskDesc: Drag and place the wall at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.8.TaskDesc: Build the wall at the designated position through Point mode.
Text.Tasks.9.TaskDesc: Select the eraser mode to erase a wall and leave a place for the door.
Text.Tasks.16.TaskDesc: Put the door on the right place through the point mode.
Text.Tasks.17.TaskDesc: Place the door at the specified location indicated by the system by clicking.
Text.Tasks.20.TaskDesc: Tap Bed to begin the placing mode.
Text.Tasks.20.UiData.Name: Life
Text.Tasks.21.TaskDesc: Place the bed at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.22.TaskDesc: Place the bed at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.25.TaskDesc: Tap Oil Lamp to begin the placing mode.
Text.Tasks.25.UiData.Name: Decoration
Text.Tasks.26.TaskDesc: Place the Oil Lamp at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.27.TaskDesc: Place the Oil Lamp at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.32.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.33.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.35.TaskDesc: Wait until the construction is complete.
Text.Tasks.37.TipsData.Desc: After the tutorial for room planning, the player can plan other rooms according to their needs, but remember that the largest size of a room is 400 and the smallest is 3.
Text.Tasks.40.TaskDesc: Tap the first character and arrange the bed for him.
Text.Tasks.40.UiData.Name: Assign
Text.Tasks.44.TaskDesc: Select the room by clicking the empty area in it.
Text.Tasks.45.TipsData.Desc: The player can use this to check the current temperature in the room.
Text.Tasks.46.TipsData.Desc: The player can use this to check the effect of the room.
Text.Tasks.47.TipsData.Desc: The player can use this to check the layout of the room.
Text.Tasks.48.TipsData.Desc: The player can use this to check the attractiveness of the room.
Text.Tasks.49.TipsData.Desc: Having a room is one of the most basic needs for disciples. It is important to provide a comfortable room for disciples.
Text.Tasks.50.TipsData.Desc: Having a room is one of the most basic needs for disciples. It is important to provide a comfortable room for disciples.

Text.Name: ExploreMap
Text.Desc: Learn basic exploration in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Chapters.0.Tasks.1: Inspect the Creature and Box Found
Text.Chapters.1.Tasks.1: Inspect the Soil and Ores Found
Text.Tasks.2.TaskDesc: Tap the fogged in the bottom left corner to issue an Explore task.
Text.Tasks.3.TaskDesc: Click the fogged in the bottom left corner to issue an Explore task.
Text.Tasks.6.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.7.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.9.TaskDesc: Wait until the exploration is complete.
Text.Tasks.11.TaskDesc: Click the cargo box found in the exploration.
Text.Tasks.12.TipsData.Desc: Resources are found during exploration. Open them using the interactive button.
Text.Tasks.12.TipsData.Name: Search
Text.Tasks.13.TaskDesc: Click the rabbit found in the exploration.
Text.Tasks.14.TipsData.Desc: Some wild animal is found. Hunt or tame it to obtain resources.
Text.Tasks.16.TipsData.Desc: Useful resources and animals can be found during exploration. The player can acquire these resources in the early stages and the animals can be used to hunt or farm.
Text.Tasks.20.TaskDesc: Wait until the exploration is complete.
Text.Tasks.21.TaskDesc: Wait until the exploration is complete.
Text.Tasks.23.TaskDesc: Tap the ore vein found in the exploration.
Text.Tasks.26.TipsData.Desc: This is a fertile soil that can be used for farming.
Text.Tasks.28.TipsData.Desc: Ore veins and fertile soils can be found during exploration. The player can use them for mining and farming if needed.
Text.Tasks.30.TipsData.Desc: Ore veins and fertile soils can be found during exploration. The player can use them for mining and farming if needed.
Text.Tasks.34.TaskDesc: Wait until the exploration is complete.
Text.Tasks.35.TaskDesc: Click the fogged area in the top left corner to issue an Explore task.
Text.Tasks.37.TaskDesc: Tap the giant ginkgo found in the exploration.
Text.Tasks.40.TaskDesc: Click the giant ginkgo found in the exploration.
Text.Tasks.41.TipsData.Desc: Giant ginkgo is not only beautiful but can also gather Qi. It is a helpful and rare resource for the early stage of training.
Text.Tasks.42.TaskDesc: Click the lotus found in the exploration.
Text.Tasks.43.TipsData.Desc: In the early stages, lotus is an affordable resource for food.
Text.Tasks.45.TipsData.Desc: The player can use Explore to gradually search all the areas in the map and discover new resources, soils, animals, etc.

Text.Name: BaseSave
Text.Desc: Learn basic survival in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Chapters.1.Tasks.0: Use Hunt Order in Character Menu
Text.Chapters.1.Tasks.1: Use Hunt Order in Prey's Menu
Text.Tasks.1.TaskDesc: Tap Build in the bottom left corner to open the Build page.
Text.Tasks.2.TaskDesc: Tap Work to open the Work Buildings page.
Text.Tasks.3.UiData.Name: Work
Text.Tasks.4.TaskDesc: Place the well at the designated location.
Text.Tasks.9.TaskDesc: Select a workstation to show its status below.
Text.Tasks.11.TaskDesc: Wait until the construction is complete.
Text.Tasks.13.TipsData.Desc: Wells can provide a source of clean water for characters. Water can also be stored in a water vat for contingencies.
Text.Tasks.17.TaskDesc: Click the hen in the top right corner to hunt it.
Text.Tasks.21.TaskDesc: Click to select an animal to be Hunted.
Text.Tasks.21.UiData.Name: Hunt
Text.Tasks.26.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.27.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.30.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.34.TipsData.Desc: Use Hunt to quickly obtain food. But the number of animals is limited and their breeding rate is slow, so farming is necessary for constant resources of food.
Text.Tasks.36.TaskDesc: Select a field in the designated fertile soil.
Text.Tasks.38.UiData.Name: Area
Text.Tasks.40.TaskDesc: Select a field in the designated fertile soil.
Text.Tasks.43.TaskDesc: Tap the interactive button Grow Plants.
Text.Tasks.46.TaskDesc: Select a plant and tap the confirm button.
Text.Tasks.47.TaskDesc: Click the interactive button Grow Plants.
Text.Tasks.47.UiData.Name: Grow Plants
Text.Tasks.48.TaskDesc: Players can click on wheat to view information about wheat farming.
Text.Tasks.50.TaskDesc: Select a plant and then click confirm
Text.Tasks.52.TipsData.Desc: There are many kinds of food in the game. Not only can crops grow in soil, they can also grow in water.

Text.Name: StrongArea
Text.Desc: Learn basic storage planning in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Tasks.1.TipsData.Desc: Different resources are located in different areas, and as their number increases, it will be inconvenient for the player to access them, so storage is used to categorize and manage resources.
Text.Tasks.2.TipsData.Desc: First, let's plan an area for materials and tools in the middle, so it will be easy to access them as your sect expands to all directions.
Text.Tasks.3.TaskDesc: Tap Build in the bottom left corner to open the Build page.
Text.Tasks.5.TaskDesc: Tap Storage to begin storage planning.
Text.Tasks.5.UiData.Name: Area
Text.Tasks.6.TaskDesc: Select a storage in the designated area.
Text.Tasks.10.TaskDesc: Select a workstation to show its status below.
Text.Tasks.13.TaskDesc: Tap the Filter button to open the storage panel.
Text.Tasks.14.TaskDesc: Click the Storage Filter button to open the Storage Filter page
Text.Tasks.14.UiData.Name: Filter
Text.Tasks.15.TipsData.Desc: Filter can be used to plan a detailed storage that allows items to be stored according to their type, elemental attribute, tier and quality. Remember, when multiple storages are put together, the filter of a single storage will not be applied to the others.
Text.Tasks.16.TaskDesc: Tap Close to close this panel
Text.Tasks.17.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.19.TipsData.Desc: Some resources will spoil as time progresses, so we need a low temperature storage for this type of resources.
Text.Tasks.21.TipsData.Desc: Next, we will plan a storage area for food near the kitchen for more efficient access while cooking, and a closed room helps to adjust the temperature for better storage of food.
Text.Tasks.23.TaskDesc: Tap Storage to begin storage planning.
Text.Tasks.24.TaskDesc: Drag and select a storage in the designated area.
Text.Tasks.24.UiData.Name: Area
Text.Tasks.26.TaskDesc: Drag and select a storage in the designated area.
Text.Tasks.29.TaskDesc: Select a workstation to show its status below.
Text.Tasks.32.TaskDesc: Tap Tool to leave out all tools.
Text.Tasks.33.TaskDesc: Tap Misc. to leave out miscellaneous resources.
Text.Tasks.33.UiData.Name: Filter
Text.Tasks.34.TaskDesc: Tap Material to leave out all materials.
Text.Tasks.35.TaskDesc: Tap Equipment to leave out all equipment.
Text.Tasks.36.TaskDesc: Tap Cultivation to leave out cultivation-related resources.
Text.Tasks.37.TaskDesc: Tap Close to close this panel
Text.Tasks.38.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.39.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.40.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.41.TaskDesc: After a while, the disciples will store the items according to their category.
Text.Tasks.43.TaskDesc: After a while, the disciples will store the items according to their category.
Text.Tasks.45.TipsData.Desc: Once there are too many items in store, the player can expand and plan other storages for more detailed management and easier access to the info of resources.
Text.Tasks.47.TaskDesc: Double-click to select the room containing Warehouse 2
Text.Tasks.48.TipsData.Desc: Because a room is a closed area, room temperature can be adjusted by placing a source of heat.
Text.Tasks.51.UiData.Name: Place Item
Text.Tasks.55.UiData.Name: Place Item
Text.Tasks.56.TaskDesc: Wait for them to be placed.
Text.Tasks.58.TaskDesc: Tap twice to select the room where the Storage 2 is in.
Text.Tasks.60.TaskDesc: Double-click to select the room containing Warehouse 2
Text.Tasks.61.TaskDesc: Wait for 5 seconds, observe the change in room temperature
Text.Tasks.62.TipsData.Desc: Now we've secured food and other materials in separate storages. As the game progresses, it may require more detailed categorization, which can be realized by Filter.
Text.Tasks.64.TipsData.Desc: Now we've secured food and other materials in separate storages. As the game progresses, it may require more detailed categorization, which can be realized by Filter.

Text.Name: MemberExpansion
Text.Desc: Learn basic expanding in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Chapters.1.DisplayName: Arrange Work for the New Member
Text.Tasks.1.TaskDesc: Wait for the event for accepting refugees to pop up.
Text.Tasks.3.TipsData.Desc: In the game, there will be refugees asking to join the sect. It is a good opportunity for expansion, but growing too fast will put pressure on infrastructure and food provision, so please consider carefully.
Text.Tasks.6.TaskDesc: Tap the adopt on the character panel.
Text.Tasks.6.UiData.Name: Accept
Text.Tasks.7.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.8.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.10.TaskDesc: Wait until your people accept this character.
Text.Tasks.12.TipsData.Desc: You've gained a new character. Each character excels at a type of work. Open the Work Schedule menu and arrange suitable work for each character.
Text.Tasks.14.TaskDesc: Tap to open the Work Schedule menu.
Text.Tasks.15.TaskDesc: Long press to see the character's ablity for this job. Try to pick the best one to do the job.
Text.Tasks.16.TaskDesc: Because the first character has the best ability to be a healer, tap the third character's healer position to cancel it.
Text.Tasks.17.TaskDesc: Because the third character has the best ability to be a miner, tap the first character's miner position to cancel it.
Text.Tasks.18.TaskDesc: Because the third character has the best ability to be a miner, click the first character's miner position to cancel it.
Text.Tasks.21.TipsData.Desc: You've assigned work for the characters, and providing a suitable tool can greatly improve their work efficiency.
Text.Tasks.24.UiData.Name: Produce
Text.Tasks.27.TaskDesc: Wait until the production is complete.
Text.Tasks.28.TaskDesc: Wait until the production is complete.
Text.Tasks.30.TaskDesc: Select a character that needs the pickaxe.
Text.Tasks.32.UiData.Name: Equip
Text.Tasks.35.TaskDesc: Wait until the character equips the pickaxe.
Text.Tasks.36.TaskDesc: Wait until the character equips the pickaxe.
Text.Tasks.38.TipsData.Desc: Assigning a suitable job to a new disciple helps improve work efficiency for the whole sect. When arranging different jobs, different tools should be provided to disciples to increase their individual efficiency.
Text.Tasks.40.TipsData.Desc: If a character's needs are not met, their moods will be negatively affected, which lowers their work efficiency and even makes them slack in work. Now let's see what the new character needs.
Text.Tasks.41.TaskDesc: Tap to open the character panel
Text.Tasks.44.TipsData.Desc: The character needs a room. Arrange a spare room for him.
Text.Tasks.44.TipsData.Name: Room Needed
Text.Tasks.48.TaskDesc: Tap the first character and arrange the bed for him.
Text.Tasks.48.UiData.Name: Assign
Text.Tasks.52.TipsData.Desc: Pay careful attention to the characters' moods and satisfy their needs to ensure that the sect runs more efficiently. Besides waiting for refugees to join, the player can send inner disciples out to find new characters to join or participate in special events to recruit new disciples after establishing the sect. The player can explore these advanced contents while playing the game.

Text.Name: Treatment
Text.Desc: Learn basic healing in this tutorial.\n[color=#BC1717](During the tutorial, players can press Esc twice to skip the task and continue the tutorial. )[/color]
Text.Tasks.2.TaskDesc: Select medicine tab to see details
Text.Tasks.2.UiData.Name: Medicine
Text.Tasks.3.TipsData.Desc: Each medicine in the game has its own effect, for example, Healing Balm treats wounds, Bone Healing Balm treats bone fractures, Healing Pill treats internal organs, etc. When the medical supplies are insufficient, injured disciples might not be treated in time, so please pay close attention to the storage of medicine.
Text.Tasks.6.TaskDesc: Tap to open the Work Schedule menu.
Text.Tasks.7.TaskDesc: Players can see skill requirements and works of a healer through long press the Healer Work.
Text.Tasks.8.TaskDesc: Because the second disciple has the best ability to be a healer, select the disciple to be a healer and tap to activate.
Text.Tasks.12.TaskDesc: Tap the interactive button Produce on the table.
Text.Tasks.13.UiData.Name: Produce
Text.Tasks.15.TipsData.Desc: View the production instructions and effects of Healing Balm.
Text.Tasks.16.TaskDesc: Tap to close the Produce page on the table.
Text.Tasks.17.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.18.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.19.TaskDesc: Tap the speed switch in the bottom-right corner, and switch to the highest speed.
Text.Tasks.21.TaskDesc: Wait until the Healing Balm is made.
Text.Tasks.23.TipsData.Desc: There are not many herbs in the wild, so the player can plan a herb garden in advance to ensure a steady supply of herbs.
Text.Tasks.26.TaskDesc: Tap the message that someone injured
Text.Tasks.27.TaskDesc: Click the message about the character being injured
Text.Tasks.29.TaskDesc: Tap to opend the injured guy's character panel.
Text.Tasks.31.TaskDesc: You can check changes of the wound by long pressing the Infection area.
Text.Tasks.32.TaskDesc: You can tap the "Left thigh bone" area to check the injury type and effects.
Text.Tasks.33.TaskDesc: Tap to close the Health menu.
Text.Tasks.34.TaskDesc: Click to close the Health menu.
Text.Tasks.36.TaskDesc: Tap and activate the position Healer.
Text.Tasks.37.TaskDesc: Tap Top Priority to open the drop-down list.
Text.Tasks.38.TaskDesc: Tap Healer to set the position as top priority.
Text.Tasks.43.TipsData.Desc: When a disciple set as the healer is injured, it is possible that no character will treat the disciple. The player can assign the healer's job to another disciple and adjust the work schedule and priority, or interrupt any disciple's current action, in order to treat the injured disciple.
Text.Tasks.46.TaskDesc: We can see that the injury is healing, which means the disciple has been effectively treated.
Text.Tasks.47.TaskDesc: You can check changes of the wound by long pressing the Infection area.
Text.Tasks.48.TaskDesc: We can see that the injury is healing, which means the disciple has been effectively treated.
Text.Tasks.50.TipsData.Desc: There are other items in the game that improve healing effects, such as talismans and acupuncture, waiting for the player to explore.
